summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing travel approval and logistical planning for an interview in Stockholm, Sweden, as part of the ongoing Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails reveal bureaucratic frustrations with the government travel system (E2) and reference several prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Maia
persons.context: Appears to be a member of the prosecution team traveling for interviews in the Epstein case, mentioned in travel requests for Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

connections.description: Both are members of the same prosecution/investigation team traveling together for interviews in the Epstein case.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: Prosecution team plans to travel from JFK to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation, with travel dates around late January/early February 2020.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel for an interview (or interviews) in Los Angeles as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel for an interview in Los Angeles on November 14, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Maia and another team member requested travel for an interview in West Palm Beach on November 4, 2019, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: The team requested travel for a victim interview in Los Angeles, with Maia, M, and potentially others involved.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: The team requested travel for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Request for West Palm Beach
events.description: A travel request was approved for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach for the case United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida
events.description: Maia and another person requested permission to travel for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document shows active investigation travel for the Epstein case (2018R01618) into early 2020, including an international trip to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview.
Prosecutors express significant frustration with the DOJ's E2 travel system, citing incorrect hotel locations, inflated prices compared to public sites, and bureaucratic hurdles.
Multiple prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach are referenced, indicating an ongoing investigative effort throughout 2019.
The case is formally referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
